definition: there's still time/able to do sth in time
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: Before I could answer, she had turned around and started back out onto the field.
sentences.chinese: 我還未來得及回話，她已經轉身向足球場上走去了。

sentences.english: Hardly had I had time to say 'Goodbye' to the last year when the new year came here.
sentences.chinese: 還沒有來得及辭舊歲，新年就已經來到了。

sentences.english: He had pressed the button before we could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我們還沒來得及阻止他，他已經按了電鈕。

sentences.english: I got up late this morning and went to school without feeding my cats.
sentences.chinese: 我早上起牀晚了，所以沒來得及喂貓就上學去了。

sentences.english: Anyway, if he leaves before I see him, then tell him I said hello.
sentences.chinese: 要是我沒來得及見他，他就走了，幫我問候他。

sentences.english: The old fellow croaked before he could tell us who shot him.
sentences.chinese: 那老人沒來得及告訴我們是誰向他開的槍就斷氣了。

sentences.english: Hehad run out of the room before I could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒來得及攔住他，他就跑出了屋子。

sentences.english: And before I could even smile, I suddenly sneezed.
sentences.chinese: 還沒來得及笑出來，我突然打了個噴嚏。

sentences.english: The enemy aircraft plunged down in flames before the pilot had time to bail out.
sentences.chinese: 敵飛行員還沒來得及跳傘，飛機就冒着火栽下來了。

sentences.english: Decorations. If you have yet to decorate there is still time for that as well.
sentences.chinese: 如果你還在進行裝飾，那麼也是來得及的。

sentences.english: He had rushed out before I could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒來得及攔住他他就衝出去了。

sentences.english: They were whirled away before they could say anything.
sentences.chinese: 他們還沒來得及說什麼，就被帶走了。

sentences.english: He tore off before we said goodbye to him.
sentences.chinese: 我們還沒來得及向他道別他就匆匆走了。

sentences.english: Perhaps there was still time to intervene in behalf of that man.
sentences.chinese: 可能還來得及由他出面說一下情？

sentences.english: The thief had jumped out of the window before the police broke in.
sentences.chinese: 警察還沒來得及破門進入，小偷就已跳窗逃竄了。

sentences.english: The last post is at 7 p.m. You can still make it if you go by bike.
sentences.chinese: 最後的郵遞時間是晚上七點，你現在騎車去還來得及。

definition: there's not enough time (to do sth)/it's too late (to do sth)
hurriedly/without delay
at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
at once/immediately
just recently/just a moment ago
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
just now/a moment ago
suddenly
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to be dead/not to be, or cease to exist
see 過來|过来[guo4 lai2]
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
here
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
